mealPrepInfo.groceryList:
1. 1.5 lbs of fresh chicken breast
2. 4 tablespoons of top-quality olive oil
3. 3 cloves of fresh garlic, minced
4. 1 cup of organic, low-sodium chicken broth
5. 1 cup of skimmed milk
6. 1 cup of freshly grated Parmesan cheese
7. 3 tablespoons of unsalted butter
8. 1 white onion, finely chopped
9. 1 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper
10. 1 teaspoon of sea salt
11. 1 tablespoon of fresh thyme leaves
12. 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour
13. 1 cup of sliced fresh mushrooms
14. 1 pound of high-quality puff pastry
15. 1 free-range egg, beaten.
mealPrepInfo.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F.
2. Dice 2 large onions, 3 carrots, and 4 celery stalks.
3. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
4. Add diced vegetables to pot and sauté until softened, about 10 minutes.
5. Add 4 minced cloves of garlic and sauté for another minute.
6. Cut 2 lbs chicken into bite-sized pieces, season with salt and pepper.
7. Push vegetables to one side of the pot, add chicken pieces to the other side.
8. Brown chicken pieces, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes.
9. Sprinkle 1/4 cup flour over chicken and vegetables, stir to coat.
10. Gradually stir in 4 cups of low-sodium chicken broth.
11. Bring mixture to a simmer, stirring constantly.
12. Roll out pie crust and cut into 5 equal pieces.
13. Spoon chicken mixture into 5 individual pie dishes.
14. Cover each dish with a piece of pie crust, crimping edges to seal.
15. Cut a few small slits in the top of each pie crust to allow steam to escape.
16. Place pies on a baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.
17. Let pies cool for 10 minutes before serving.
